Text.Value: I thought I might take this opportunity to reinvent myself. Or uninvent myself, to be more accurate.
I suppose I am. Tara would be delighted. Not to mention my mother. But I'd be just as happy without such ceremony, so long as we're together.
You seem very relaxed. The orb isn't on the verge of exploding yet then?
You seem very relaxed. The orb isn't on the verge of exploding yet then?
I couldn't let you do that. You deserve better.
There will be some practicalities to iron out. The guest list, the venue, and we'll need to find a very open-minded cleric.
Was it Mystra's doing, do you think?
Was it Mystra's doing, do you think?
Are you asking me to marry you?
I - I don't believe it. I won't believe it.
You don't seem all that excited. Is something the matter?
You don't seem all that excited. Is something the matter?
You always find a smile where others would soak in their sorrows. And I promise - you'll have reason to smile soon enough.
I've decided to drop this whole 'Gale of Waterdeep' business. It's a bit... pompous, don't you think?
Of course I will. On one condition: we adopt any children.
Of course I will. On one condition: we adopt any children.
That's how I feel with you - content. It's a rather unfamiliar feeling, I must say. Not something Gale of Waterdeep ever craved.
What, then? You intend to die here? Now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Refuses to believe it - essentially been told his partner is submitting to her illness

Text.Value: I know that look. It's your heart isn't it? Not to worry - you have one of the finest wizards in the Realms at your fingertips.
Now, I believe this is the moment where I should get to my point, so to speak.

EditorData.logicalname: PLAYER NOT TIED TO BALDUR'S GATE

Text.Value: I'd forgotten what it felt like, to greet a sunrise without fear of it being my last.
I'm excited to meet this new you.
I'm excited to meet this new you.
I think we'll have plenty of time to do just that.
I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.
I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.
That's one worry I can leave behind me, at least.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of nerves, he's about to ask you to marry him...

Text.Value: If this is the end, then we face it together. That, at least, I can promise you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Heartbroken - his lover is dying next to him, thanking her for loving him

Text.Value: My Lady would not permit such a union, but it sounds wonderful, to remain close to one another.
Our relationship is perfect as it is. But Waterdeep sounds like fun.
Our relationship is perfect as it is. But Waterdeep sounds like fun.
Oh, hells. I'm sorry. Barely awake a moment and I've already put my foot in it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Kicking himself, he's accidentally rubbed salt in his partner's very sore wound

Text.Value: Your 'present condition' is that you're the one I love. And your current form is merely a reflection of the depths of your sacrifice. It only makes me love you more.
I'm sorry, Gale. I need to make my own life here. It's time you returned to Waterdeep.
I'm sorry, Gale. I need to make my own life here. It's time you returned to Waterdeep.
We have all the time in the world for that. But first, there's something I wanted to talk to you about.
I'm sorry, Gale. You'll have to return to Waterdeep alone. I've my own path to follow.
I'm sorry, Gale. You'll have to return to Waterdeep alone. I've my own path to follow.
You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?
Wake me up this early again, and you won't see many more...
Wake me up this early again, and you won't see many more...
I'm not going back, Gale. I can't.
I'll need to keep a careful study of it, make sure it's not suddenly destabilised by proximity to a rogue pair of netherese sandals or what have you, but I think it's dormant.
If our love ends here, it was no less perfect for its brevity. I will remember it, and you, always.
Say nothing. Concentrate. You feel like you might explode any second.
Oh, him. I've been thinking a lot about that. 'Gale of Waterdeep', sounds a bit... pompous, don't you think?
Whatever for? I rather like this new you.
I can't. My only hope of survival is to return to Avernus - and I'm not going back.
You're now in the company of plain old Gale Dekarios - a most brilliant wizard of intentionally limited renown. At your service.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gale bows/presents himself as though introducing himself to the player

Text.Value: There's nothing we can't handle - I promise you that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Essentially his partner just refused treatment for a terminal illness. He's putting a brave face on it so they can enjoy the time they have left.

Text.Value: And so, if you're at all amenable to the idea, I thought I could, perhaps, stay. There might even be room for two Dekarioses in Baldur's Gate?
It could be. Or perhaps the orb's hunger was fuelled by my own, and my contentment influences it in much the same way.
We'll need time to make the arrangements, of course. The catering alone will need to be quite extraordinary...

EditorData.NodeContext: Reference to 'catering' because player is now a mindflayer and therefore eats brains

Text.Value: We'll need time to make the arrangements of course - the Dekarios clan is scattered clan far and wide, and you'll have invites of your own to send out, I'm sure.
And what does freedom mean, for Gale of Waterdeep?
And what does freedom mean, for Gale of Waterdeep?
I understand your purpose lies here, but I fear if I return to Waterdeep alone, my heart would remain here with you.
I accept. The Vampire Ascendant would do well to have a Consort for his Palace.
I do feel like a new man. I was going to speak to you about that, as a matter of fact.
All the ducal heraldry has already been drawn up... I'll go for 'Dekarios-Ravengard' if you will.
But that's all to come. The day is young, and there are thousands more days ahead of us.
It's strange, but somehow I woke up this morning and realised the orb feels different. No clamour, no desperation, no hunger.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'And mine...' leading into explanation of his 'new dawn' on the next line

Text.Value: I could get used to that feeling.
I could get used to that feeling.
If you were with me, I might be able to handle it.
Both of us have been blessed with a new dawn - you should feel no shame at the nature of yours. And mine...
Not a morning person, I take it? I can scratch that from the list of wonderfully ordinary things I've still to learn about you.
That being said, I wondered if you might consider accompanying me back to Waterdeep as a new member of the Dekarios clan?

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous, he's promosing marriage, in a roundabout way

Text.Value: You can't blame a fellow for trying. If you're contented as we are, then so am I.
You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.
I deserve the chance to live my life with the raging inferno I love. If that means relocating to the hells, so be it. I've heard Avernus is quite lovely this time of year.
In fact, your tentacular transformation has inspired me to make a little change of my own.
I see. Well, I've no desire to stand in the way of the future you've chosen.

EditorData.NodeContext: disappointed but accepts it because he loves you

Text.Value: No, Gale. Neither of us is going to that pit. It all ends here. Now. I just want to see the sky one last time.
You will? Oh, thank goodness for that.
When we get to Waterdeep, we'll search in my library. It's bound to contain the odd scroll on hellish thermodynamics. Or a spell that might diffuse the heat in such a way that -
I'd love to, Gale, but I can't. My engine is done. Fully cooked.
Soon, I'll deliver the crown to Mystra, and be rid of the orb at long last. I'll be free.
Not the matter, but there is a matter I wanted to speak to you about.
I'm not normally one to rise with the birds myself, but something disturbed my sleep.

EditorData.logicalname: NOT KARLACH, GALE RETURNING CROWN TO MYSTRA

Text.Value: If you go were to return to the hells - temporarily - it would buy us some time. I could put something together, a means of keeping you stable at least. Please, let me try.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to convince her, scared by what she's saying (that she's ready to die)

Text.Value: And hand myself to Zariel on a platter? No thanks.
I'll marry you, but I can't live in Waterdeep.
I'll marry you, but I can't live in Waterdeep.
It's equally strange to wake and feel the sun on this body. I'm not sure what to make of it.
It does, doesn't it?
What if... what if I went with you?
I love you, more than I've ever loved anyone, mortal or immortal. And you've proven your love for me in more ways than even the greatest mathematicians would dare to count.
I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.
I accept. I can have a true family at last.
I accept. I'll marry you, Gale Dekarios.
Besides, it would be quite something to study infernal magic in its natural environs. I say 'natural' in the loosest sense, of course.
I've no interest in marriage. But life with you in Baldur's Gate sounds wonderful.
I've no interest in marriage. But life with you in Baldur's Gate sounds wonderful.
Free to come back to bed...
Free to come back to bed...
Ah. But I'm getting ahead of myself. Do you... that is, would you consider returning to Waterdeep with me?

EditorData.NodeContext: A bit nervous to ask - this is Karlach, after all

Text.Value: Quite. Though on the subject of our future plans, there was something I wanted to discuss with you.
It's taken me long enough to find you. I'll be damned if I'm letting you go.
I promise we'll make it work, if you'll have me?
Don't be. It's not your fault.
Then I go where you go. Waterdeep wouldn't be home without you, anyway.
You'd really wish to marry me, in my present condition?
Come now - resignation doesn't suit you half as well as optimism. We'll find some other means of fixing up that infernal engine of yours.
That's a relief. Can't say I was thrilled at the prospect of chasing you around the Sword Coast snacking on trinkets.
That's a relief. Can't say I was thrilled at the prospect of chasing you around the Sword Coast snacking on trinkets.
That does lead me to a more pressing matter. Exactly how large is your library?
Don't be. At least one of us will get the cure we were hoping for.
It's curious. After all the wonders and monstrosities we've witnessed, waking beside you seems more unreal than any of it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wistful/peaceful - spent a romantic night with the person he loves

Text.Value: I hesitate to say it, but I think it's... satisfied.
There remains only one matter to be resolved - for me, at least.
Knowing you, I'd expect nothing less.
You're lucky. I wish my own condition were so easily cured.

Synopsis:
Gale speaks with his love interest player in a private bedroom upstairs at an inn. They've saved the world and just spent the night together. Now they take a moment to discuss what's in store for them. Gale will either:
- Wish to retrieve a powerful (and dangerous) artefact that was lost during the climactic battle
- Wish to return to his life in Waterdeep.
